Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. You guys have probably noticed my stomach's a little more sensitive lately. So, if you wouldn't mind wearing a little less perfume... and if your lunch is especially pungent, maybe have it in the break room?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We would really appreciate it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam is constantly throwing up because of the pregnancy. If she eats something the fetus doesn't like she is screwed. It's amazing. A three ounce fetus is calling the shots. It's so bad ass.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Phyllis, if you could switch to a different soap, just for a month or two? Yours is kind of perfumy.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Now this is getting ridiculous.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, gee, I'm sorry. I guess I missed the meeting where we all all voted for you to get pregnant. No! I reserve the right to peel my hard-boiled eggs at my desk.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: All morning I look forward to my afternoon cigars and I'm not stopping for anyone.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think I'm asking for too much. I guess it's just the end of courtesy in the workplace.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Dwight peels a hard-boiled egg at his desk, sniffs it and takes a bite; Pam stares at him, picks up her trash can and pukes into it] Watching people get sick always makes me sick. And... frankly so does talking about it. So... wow... [Andy, Phyllis, Meredith, Erin, Oscar and Angela all proceed to throw up in various places while Creed looks on eating a bowl of noodles; Dwight stares shocked; Pam wipes her mouth with a satisfied look]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [standing next to a car decorated for leaving a wedding] What do you think? I spent all morning on it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It is really special.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, but aren't you supposed to do that to our... no. It's great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's just a really important day for me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, congrats.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin Scranton will be closed today and Friday for a company wedding in Niagara Falls. So, please leave a message and we'll get back to you as soon as possible. Have a great day.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Believe it or not, Kevin, fire crackers are in the don't column.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So... you're going to provide them, then?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. This is a fire cracker free wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What the hell?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on. You've got to be kidding me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok. All of these things are important to remember but the most important thing is no one say anything about my pregnancy at the wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Absolutely. 'Cause not everyone knows and some people may be offended.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Decent people everywhere will get offended.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, we're thinking of my grandmother who we haven't told and is very old-fashioned.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, you're lucky you have a grandmother. Some of us have to be our own grandmothers.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's nice.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know, Angela, you don't have to come to the wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Really, Pam...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes she does. Yes she does. We're all gonna go and we're gonna have a good time. [hugs Angela]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ow! He pinched me!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Next time we're all in this room Jim and I will be married.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We'll see.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good-bye.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: See you later. [others say good-bye]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And, hey, don't embarrass me when we go to Niagara.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What happens in Niagara, stays in Niagara. [laughter]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't. Don't. Don't. You stole my joke. Don't steal my joke.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No... I didn't steal your joke.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. I said that yesterday.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But you can say that about anything.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What happens in accounting, stays in accounting.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No. No. Please, please. Dwight, that's my joke.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's easy. That's what I'm saying.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is what I'm talking about. When we leave here and go up to Niagara Falls we are representing Dunder Mifflin, everyone. This is a very important wedding for the branch. The most important wedding until I get married. So, I want you all on your best behavior or so help me, God. So... I will see you up there in Viagra Falls!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam and Jim's wedding will be the single best pick up destination in the history of the universe.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I stole the guest list from Jim's desk and I search engined every female on both sides of the family.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Get out of here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, my God, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: For instance, Pam's cousin, Jocelyn Webster.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There's... a name.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Two years ago she was selling a mountain bike.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Well, tell me about Jocelyn.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well... she was really into mountain biking but not so much lately.

Quote.Speaker: Micheal
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: She had a couple hundred dollars to spend, I mean, if she was able to sell her bike.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is that all you have on her?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, if this is in fact her because it is a very common name.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're an idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: People don't think of me as one of the sharper dressers in the office... but I'm going ot turn that around at this wedding. I thought, how could I take it to the next level? The hair. [Angela beeps her car horn.] It's the hair- [beeps again.] Ok. Ok. I'm going. [long beep] God.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [in Andy's car, Andy driving] Hey, do one of you guys want to sit up front with me so I have someone to talk to? It's like a five hour drive-ish, you know.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: This is so much cooler. We feel like wer're in a limo and you're our driver.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm. Erin?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh no. That wouldn't be fair to leave Kelly alone in back.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Not only is Erin really sweet and cute... she smell's like my mom.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [in car] Hey, my aunt told me something neat.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: She said everything with the wedding goes by so fast we should try to take mental pictures of the high points.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, wow. That's cool.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [aims imaginary camera at Pam] Click. Oh, you blinked. Damn it. Now that's in my brain forever.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Lousy Picture.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We should have hired a professional to take our mental pictures.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in car, Michael driving] Oh! God! Wow! Oh. I was asleep.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What? No way!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Those glasses are super dark.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh. God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright. We need some tunes, I think.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what? I made you a cd...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You did?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was nice of you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is to play when you bring a woman back to your hotel room.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, very thoughtful. A little mix to set the mood. Delightful. Pop that in.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're gonna like this. [Dwight's voice on the cd] "Hello. This is Dwight Schrute. If you are listening to this you are a lucky woman Michael has seduced. Ah to be in your shoes. 'What's next?', you're probably wondering. Don't be scared of you're night in heaven-" [Michael turns off cd]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you serious? You want me to play that for a woman coming to my room?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah. It's practical.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No. That's not how it works.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Niagara Falls used to be, like, a spiritual experience for people. They stayed in tents and it blew their minds. It's really kitchy now, which is a lot of fun.

Quote.Speaker: Front Desk Clerk
Quote.Text: Halpert...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And Beesly. Tonight we're in two seperate rooms and tomorrow night is the honeymoon suite.

Quote.Speaker: Front Desk Clerk
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know. We're pretty excited, too.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Can we take a look at the suite now?

Quote.Speaker: Front Desk Clerk
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry. Somebody just checked in.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh... is there another wedding at the hotel this weekend?

Quote.Speaker: Front Desk Clerk
Quote.Text: Oh, no. Just an individual. That man over there.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey. I got the room the night before you guys. I'll break in the bed. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't like that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm gonna need the name and cell phone number of the housekeeper responsible for changing the sheets, please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello. Reservation for Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Front Desk Clerk
Quote.Text: One moment while I check.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The proximity to the falls makes everything smell like a basement.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Front Desk Clerk
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, sir, but I'm not seeing you in here. When did you make your reservation?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't have a reservation but I want a room in the Halpert-Beesly block of rooms.

Quote.Speaker: Front Desk Clerk
Quote.Text: Oh, ok. Unfortunately, sir, the block only applies to the rate. I'm afraid we're all sold out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dwight Schrute. I have a reservation. Confirmation number: Romeo. Tango. G7745.

Quote.Speaker: Front Desk Clerk
Quote.Text: Yes. Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And I had spoken to Teresa about a room with two safes?

Quote.Speaker: Front Desk Clerk
Quote.Text: Sure. No problem.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Front Desk Clerk
Quote.Text: Here's your key, Mr. Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight. Dwight, Dwight. I need to stay in your room.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No way. What if I meet someone?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm staying in your- Come on, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I would do the same for you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You would?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes... just go-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait a second. Oh. No, no, no. This must be some kind of mistake. This reservation seems to be under an M. Scott. This must be yours.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Thank God.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh no. Now that I don't have a room, can I stay with you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um... no. And you know what? I would say yes but you can't. And I'll tell you why.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If I have a woman up there and things are getting amorous, she's going to get turned off if she looks in he bathroom and sees you brushing your teeth with butter and clay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok. Ok. A-ha-ha! [rips reservation out of Michael's hand] That was a test. You have failed. For this is my room. You would not share with me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't have a room?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No you do not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. 'Oooh. You must pass the dungeon wisdom test.'

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It worked.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jerk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When Mary was denied a room at the inn... Jesus was born. When Michael was denied a room at the inn, we don't know what happens because that story hasn't been told yet.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Mr. and Mrs. Stanley Hudson.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey. Stanley? Can I stay in your room tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Are you crazy? I brought Cynthia with me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not in the same bed. In the other bed.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I got one queen size bed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You... are... kidding me.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: A queen size bed is five feet wide. I am not five feet wide, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not a physics major, Stanley. I'm just saying be careful. Hey, guys. Hey. Could I stay in your room tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh. Gross.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Blow my brains out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's rude.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael, I have one extra twin bed, if you want.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are going to be slepping by yourself for the rest of your life, so you just get used to it.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Halpert
Quote.Text: So, which one is Pam's grandma?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, Mema? She's the one in the teal suit. She's the only 80 year old with no smile wrinkles.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dad, remember, no mention of the baby, right?

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Halpert
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah, yeah. She's very conservative. So, mum's the word.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mom, Dad. This is Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Halpert
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How ya doin'?

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Halpert
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Halpert
Quote.Text: Nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who's doing a toast? I would like to go third. Sort of bat clean up and-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, I thought we discussed that we would rather you not speak, like, at all. Because it's just going to be blood relatives, I think.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [talking quietly, trying not to move his lips]That is seriously going to impeed my ability to hook up with your female relatives.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pretty sure everyone heard that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Didn't move my lips.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Mema.

Quote.Speaker: Mema
Quote.Text: I wasn't sure about your branch of the family. After I heard about your parent's divorce. But you and Jim are just perfect. God bless you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh. Thank you... but nobody's perfect.

Quote.Speaker: Mema
Quote.Text: Well... I wouldn't care to live if I thought that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mr. Beesly. How are ya?

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Beesly
Quote.Text: I'd like you to meet Christy Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. Is this, uh, is this your niece?

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Beesly
Quote.Text: [laughs] No no. She's my girlfriend. Hey? Can you make room at the head table?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: From quarter three to quarter four up 17 percent, while his sales down two percent. It's all in the report.

Quote.Speaker: Little Girl
Quote.Text: Why would they make the bad man a boss if you're so much smarter?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Excellent question. Because while I was busy trying to improve the company and make it a success, Jim... the bad man was busy kissing the boss man's butt.

Quote.Speaker: Kids
Quote.Text: Ewwww!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's right. It is ew. It is very ew.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oscar, Kevin, this is my sister, Penny. She's also my maid of honor.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Pleased to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Penny
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, it's Kevin. I thought it was Gil?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: She thought I was your boyfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You thought I was dating this? What the hell is wrong with you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oscar, it was an honest mistake.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Him? Him?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oscar, I would be proud to date you.

Quote.Speaker: Penny
Quote.Text: I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm not gay. I'm Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Penny
Quote.Text: Nice to meet you, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You owe me and apology.

Quote.Speaker: Penny
Quote.Text: I'm so sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Are you seeing anyone right now?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: She has a boyfriend. He's out of town.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [to a girl sitting next to him] I was the youngest VP in the company history.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: More recently, he worked in a bowling alley. Tell her one of your funny bowling alley stories.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Um... also-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: How did Meredith get put at the young people's table?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: She probably switched cards with someone. Like I did with Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What? You're kid- That's- You're-

Quote.Speaker: Isabel
Quote.Text: Jim and Pam, I can't tell you how happy I am to be here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Head table, where I belong.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's just for family.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, who's that one?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Isabel Poreba. Oh, I've got stuff on her. [laughs] In 1996 her tenth grade volleyball team went 10-2.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What am I supposed to do with that, Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's a very good record.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Alright, so I'll be like, 'You're so sweet guys and so kind'.

Quote.Speaker: Tom
Quote.Text: That's when I'll do the face, like-

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Like, 'What? What?'. And then we'll just give him a little punch in the back and-

Quote.Speaker: Tom
Quote.Text: A noogie?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: You know what? Never too married for a noogie.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They have hilarious material and they are going to totally deliver it wrong. I would kill with the brother stuff. It should be me... up there. It should be me and Pete, not Pete and Tom.

Quote.Speaker: Tom
Quote.Text: Pam, you've got the greatest smile and you're body is really fine.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Smoking.

Quote.Speaker: Tom
Quote.Text: Hoping it'll make our wives take it up a notch.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: A little mo' cardio.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's not appropriate. Hello. Hi, everybody. I promised I wasn't gonna make a toast and I'm not going to. Just going to do a little free standing comedy and if at the end everybody wants to raise their glasses to Pam and Jim, then so be it. Hey, what is the deal with the Smart Car? How smart is that? Those things are tiny. Can you even drive them in traffic? 'I'm so smart. E=mc... squared. I drive a Smart Car.' That's not smart in my book. The real smart car is Kitt from Knight Rider.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Knight Rider.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's a car that can talk. Can Smart Car talk? Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's not smart. And also, Chitty Chitty Bang Bang. [no one is laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Very smart.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And... you... everybody can laugh. It doesn't have to just be the idiots. Everybody can laugh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright. Hey, everyone. Thanks for coming.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Douche.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Aw, thanks, Pete. That was really nice. I just want to say how happy we are that all of you are here tonight. And I want to especially thank those of you who traveled from far away to be here with us tonight... especially the Flordia cousins who, obviously, can't take a hint. [laughter] Four years ago, I was just a guy who had a crush on a girl who had a boyfriend. And I had to do the hardest thing that I've ever had to do... which was just to wait. Uh, don't get me wrong. I flirted with her. Pam, I can now admit in front of my friends and family that I do know how to make a photo copy. Didn't need your help that many times. And do you remember how long it took you to teach me how to drive a stick?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Like... a year.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I've been driving stick since high school. So... yes. For a really long time that's all I had. I just had little moments with a girl who saw me as friend. And a lot of people told me I was crazy to wait this long for a date with a girl who I worked with, but I think even then I knew that... I was waiting for my wife. So... I would like to propose a toast. So if you'd all raise your glasses. Not Pam, for obvious reasons, but everyone else. If you would raise your glasses-

Quote.Speaker: Mema
Quote.Text: What's obvious? Why can't Pam drink?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam can't drink? I didn't- I shouldn't have said that. I don't know why I did. She can do whatever she wants, though she shouldn't. She shouldn't because she's an alcoholic. Pam is an alcoholic. That's not true. I- no. What we want- the real reason is that, that Pam's pregnant.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [clears throat] Ok. Ok. Hey. What I think Jim is trying to say is that... they had an accident and you know what? These two people, they're living together, they're having lots of consentual sex-

Quote.Speaker: Mema
Quote.Text: They were living together?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Yes they were living together. Yes and you know what? You can't expect them to be careful every time. Because, frankly, it's just a different sensation.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When you c- well? Am I wrong? They say it's not different, but it's a different sensation.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. Please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When you use something to block- I think everybody knows what I am talking about. It's not necessarily different for the woman-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...but it's different for the- ok. Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael. Stop.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright. My point is I said what I wanted to say and Mema, I hope you heard every word.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: To waiting.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [quiet and scattered] To waiting.

Quote.Speaker: Mema
Quote.Text: I should have known. The hotels television set had a movie on called "Bruno" last night. The remote control had so darn many buttons on it, I couldn't turn it off. So I had to just sit there while it happened to me. I wondered, 'How could they pick such a hotel?' Hmmm. Now I know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mema.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was a little touch and go at first but I think we saved it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I can't believe it was me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know. I can't believe it was you, either. I actually think it takes a lot of pressure off of me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is there something about being a manager that makes you say stupid things?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have not found that to be the case.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, smooth guys.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm so sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can you believe it? He screwed up, not me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mema's not coming to the wedding. She's leaving tomorrow morning.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. Are you serious?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There's gonna be a free room?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi, Mema. It's Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Mema
Quote.Text: Oh. You're that foul guy that kept talking about intercourse.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Yep. One in the same. May I?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am actually great with old women. In fact, for the longest time, my best friend was my grandma... and then she met Harriet and now she thinks she's better than everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Mema
Quote.Text: I want to go to bed but I can't. I can't turn that television off.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Ok. Well... hook you up, there. [turns off tv]

Quote.Speaker: Mema
Quote.Text: Oh. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Mema
Quote.Text: It was that horrible Charlie Rose.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Isn't he terrible? May I? Here's the thing. Umm... Mema, I think you just need to chill out about this whole Pam getting pregnant thing. It's not 1890 anymore. It's modern day. And women have sex before marriage and I think we need to celebrate that. And I know in your day she would be considered a whore but, now, women go out and they have sex and they get wild and they take their tops off and they have pictures taken of them and we need to encouage them. That's part of life.

Quote.Speaker: Mema
Quote.Text: People are like cats and dogs these days.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Mema
Quote.Text: This used to be such a great country.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Mema
Quote.Text: I don't know what happened to it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They're gonna name the baby after you, you know. They're gonna call it Mema.

Quote.Speaker: Mema
Quote.Text: You mean, Sylvia.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, and if it's a boy they will call it Sylvio.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Partay. Room 639.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Chicks are gonna be off the hook. Guys, too, Oscar. Like Calvin Klein models.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That sounds epic. Can we bring anything?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Nothing. Except $40 for beer and any hot chicks you know. 'Cause that would help me deliver on some promises I made. Woo!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No one from the office has been to a real Bernard throw down.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: If I was girl, I would seriously reconsdier coming to this party. But don't tell anyone that I said that, 'cause I want them to come.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: And where do you think you're going?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I was just going to go down to the hotel bar for a little bit.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, why don't I just save you some time and kick you in the stomach instead?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I just wanted to get out of my room for a little while.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm. Ok. I'll go with you. Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [sighs] Nevermind.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Are you sure?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It'll be fun.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you wearing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What? It's a casual, social outfit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Looks like you're going to a fish fry, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. They're howling at the moon. It's suggestive to women because of the howling during sex.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. [Dwight howls] That's not appropriate. [Dwight continues howling] Uncool. Uncool, Dwight. [they both howl] Ok. Ok. Come on. Let's go. [both howl as they exit]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It's a good idea.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's not a good idea. There's no such thing as a good hairpiece.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah. But that's easy enough for you to say, Oscar. You have that thick, beautiful, Chicano hair. So nice.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm just worried about the farm, ya know? Mose hates to geld the horses by himself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, Dwight. Shut up about the farm. It's not relatable. Nobody owns a farm.

Quote.Speaker: Isabel
Quote.Text: Wait. You're worried about your horses? That's cool. How many horses do you have?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nine and three-quarters.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I invented a device called 'Burger on the Go'. It allows you to obtain 6 regular size hamburgers, or 12 sliders, from a horse without killing the animal. George Foreman is still considering it. Sharper Image is still considering it. Sky Mall's considering it. Hammacher Schlemer is still considering it. Sears said, 'No'.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [talking to an attractive woman] Toy Story, Finding Nemo, Up. I ball the entire time. I can not watch Pixar.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Drop this one. Abort.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I found twins.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. Twins. I'm sorry. You understand. Nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aren't they magnificent?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They're men, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I love finding a good set of twins.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Something is wrong with you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [everyone is dancing] Go Meredith. Nice moves.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You call that a robot? Try being more robotic, ok? Like this.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Lame! What else you got, Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: How about a little bit of this.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh yeah. What else you got?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What else you got?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Did someone change my name to Baskin Robbin? Because I feel like a banana split. Woo! [Andy does a split and screams out in pain]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What else you got?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It's gonna be fine. It's gonna be fine. Pam's here. [knocks on Pam's door] Pam? [knocks again]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I was dancing and I did a split and I landed on my car keys in my pocket.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I tore my scrotum. I need you to take me to the hospital.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Andy, I am getting married in 8 hours.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Everyone else is too drunk. Just don't let me die here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Hey, hey! Where are you? Can you take Andy to the hospital?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [over phone] What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He tore his scrotum dancing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [over phone] What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He is in my room icing his balls.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [over phone] What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Please stop saying what. Can you take him?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Look, I would so take him in any other circumstance, but I'm pretty certain I'm completely wasted.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Your brothers took you out drinking?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [over phone] Is that Pam? Hey, have her come out! Have her come out! It would be like Coyote Ugly.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's Michael. You're out with Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [over phone] And Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [over phone] Hey-O!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam, it just happened.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, fine. I'll take him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I love you. Okay, I gotta-I gotta go!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [over phone] I love you! [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you pushing me off the phone?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. Let's talk for a long time.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Goodbye. [hangs up phone]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm! It's after midnight. [points at Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Michael and Dwight
Quote.Text: You're married. [hugs Jim] He's married!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Congratulations.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's not how that works.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh my goodness.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh my God. You're not going to be able to talk back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You'll have Pam to answer to.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She'll be sitting home saying, "Jim... take the baby to the zoo cause I want to sit at home and eat bon-bons." [Dwight laughs] "And... and clip my toenails."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: "Jim... hey why don't you braid my hair. I want to watch TV."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Now you sound like Kermit.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are you sure this is the right way?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nope. I, like you, have never been here before.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, at least slow down a little bit because every little bump in the road is major pain on... my scrotum.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Look, I'm not the one who asked you to do a split when you've never done one before.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I was trying to liven things up a little bit. I was kinda doing your job so-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: My job? My job is to get married in the morning. That's my job.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well it's also to make sure that we have a great time at your stupid wedding, so-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Pam swerves the car back and forth] Ow, ow!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [snickers] I spent the night with the bride the night before the wedding. Ah yeah. She stepped on my hand on her way to the bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Andy, did I dream that you were crying through the night?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. No that was real.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [folding his pants on top of the ice machine, man walks in with ice bucket] Why don't you take a picture. It'll last longer. God. Can't I get a little privacy?

Quote.Speaker: Hotel Employee
Quote.Text: [Kevin rings bell at the front desk] Good morning. How can I help you?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I left a pair of dress shoes in a bag outside my door last night to be cleaned at polished, but they haven't been returned yet.

Quote.Speaker: Hotel Employee
Quote.Text: You must be Mr. Malone. One moment please.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Hotel Employee
Quote.Text: [whispers to manager] Sir. It's the man with the shoes.

Quote.Speaker: Hotel Manager
Quote.Text: Mr. Malone. Your shoes are gone.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: They were stolen?

Quote.Speaker: Hotel Manager
Quote.Text: No. Destroyed.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Hotel Manager
Quote.Text: The bag was opened by our shoe shine and the smell overcame him. I too smelled them and made the choice that they must be thrown away. Incinerated actually.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: But that was my only pair of shoes.

Quote.Speaker: Hotel Manager
Quote.Text: It became a safety issue, sir.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well... well damn-it.

Quote.Speaker: Hotel Employee
Quote.Text: I can offer you a complimentary breakfast.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [walking out of hotel room with a woman] You have everything?

Quote.Speaker: Isabel
Quote.Text: Hmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Cell phone? Charger?

Quote.Speaker: Isabel
Quote.Text: Yeah. So you sure you don't want breakfast? It's the most important meal of the day.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It really is. I'm not hungry. I ate a whole bunch of sunflower seeds after you went to sleep. And besides, I wouldn't want to take you away from Pam on the morning of her wedding. She needs you Isabel.

Quote.Speaker: Isabel
Quote.Text: That's really sweet, Dwight. So I'll see you at the wedding?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know it.

Quote.Speaker: Isabel
Quote.Text: K. [they kiss]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, get out of here.

Quote.Speaker: Isabel
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [passes Isabel] Hey, good morning. [to Dwight] It's about damn time. I haven't gone to the bathroom in a day and a half. [walks into hotel room] Oh my God, Dwight. This room is a pit.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [lays on bed] Really? I hadn't noticed. Too busy knocking boots.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [watching Dwight eat breakfast] How can you eat like that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm ravenous after a night of love making. You?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm hungry, but I'm not going to make a pig out of myself.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, what was she like?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She was cute. You know? She was hot. She was very hot. She made love like a tiger.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Brides side or grooms side? Or townie?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She was from Europe.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No kidding.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I bet she had hairy armpits.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Isabel was nice, but I hope she doesn't think this is going anywhere.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wait a second. You're not into her? Are you kidding me?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She's Pam's best friend. You guys could double date. Swap maybe?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh please. Put a gun in my mouth.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No... you're crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Look. She's a dental hygienist from Carbondale and she makes love like one. She's a bumpkin. Pass.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She's- okay. Do you know how hard it is to be a hygienist? You have to take x-rays. You have to scrape the plaque off of people's teeth. You have to tell kids when to spit and make sure they're not scared when the dentist comes in. It- it-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You should ask her out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [stands up and walks away] I already have my European girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: If your hat hits me in the face one more time-

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: That's funny. Your wife loved this hat the last time she saw it. [glares at Stanley's date]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [sees Kevin's toupee] Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oscar. Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Are you in a lot of pain?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh cause of last night? No way. Reports have been exaggerated. Weddings make me very emotional. I um-I just have that side to me.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: People say you cry all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well that's not-

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Crotch injuries are the worst. You don't need to tell me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I wasn't telling you.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Is there still something there?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: It didn't get torn off?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, it didn't-nothing got torn off. Who told you that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I may have told some people that. I'm nervous. I'm about to get married.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: If you want to sit on this- [hands Andy her wrap] I was thinking the wood might be too hard on your damaged penis. Make it softer.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It was my scrotum. Um, and it was. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, here we go. They asked for cash, but you know... I give them cash every week, so- how much cash does a person need? I have taken it upon myself to do something a little more special. I have painted a portrait of the two of them from memory. [holds up painting] And I have another one of them in the nude. But that one is for me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I got them a set of turtle boiling pots, a shell hammer and bibs.

Quote.Speaker: Penny
Quote.Text: Is it zipping over your belly? Don't squish the baby.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you weirdo.

Quote.Speaker: Pam's mom
Quote.Text: everybody see Kristie's stupid blonde extensions? It's like they were made from a plastic broom.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, here I come. [walks out in her wedding dress]

Quote.Speaker: Pam's mom
Quote.Text: Oh darling! You look beautiful.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thanks mom.

Quote.Speaker: Pam's mom
Quote.Text: Oh, I hope he deserves you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He does.

Quote.Speaker: Pam's mom
Quote.Text: Are you sure? Remember you don't have to do this. You don't.

Quote.Speaker: Penny
Quote.Text: Mom, you're totally projecting. You're being a drag.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes. Thank you, mom.

Quote.Speaker: Isabel
Quote.Text: Hey, I'm going to go outside and talk to Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay great. [Isabel kisses her cheek] Yeah, I'll see you in a second. [pauses] Wait, what? [tries to follow, but veil gets caught on wall and tears] Oh! Oh no!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [answers cell phone] Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Can you come here please?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is this allowed?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. No, but I'm allowing it. Just come here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [talking to a woman] That was an intelligent comment.

Quote.Speaker: Isabel
Quote.Text: Hello stranger. How do I look?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh. Fine. Isabel, [holds out hand] nice to see you. What do you want?

Quote.Speaker: Isabel
Quote.Text: Um... [shakes head] nothing. Anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [turns back to other woman] So, uh tell me again the difference between Filene's and Filene's basement.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Isabel] Hey, hey... He's not sitting with me either. Where are you sitting? You need a seat buddy?

Quote.Speaker: Isabel
Quote.Text: I'm standing. I'm a bridesmaid.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I wish I was a bridesmaid. Where am I gonna go?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. You look-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So beautiful. [Pam's starts to cry. Jim pulls up chair to sit next to her] Hey-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: My veil tore. I knew when we were getting married and I'm five months pregnant that I'm not going to be able to wear the dress that I always wanted or high heels-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [takes her hand] Hey. You look just as I imagined you would. Pam, you're so pretty.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [sighs] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And who cares? It's a stupid veil, right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, this was the one thing I was supposed to be able to control, was this veil and- [Jim cuts off half his tie]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There. Now we're even. [Pam laughs and mimes taking a picture, they kiss]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [sighs] Everyone's driving me crazy. I know way too much about Andy's scrotum. [Jim chuckles] And my mom won't stop freaking out about my dad's new girlfriend. [sighs] This is supposed to be our wedding day. Why did we invite all these people?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I think Pam ran away because she knew deep down she wouldn't be a good wife.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [to Kevin who is bouncing up and down] What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm trying to decide if I have time to pee.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: How long do you take to pee?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: The peeing is fast, Oscar. It's getting my tie back on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Pam's mom] Hey. Hi. Do you-would you have a snack in your purse? You're a mom. I just figured you might have-

Quote.Speaker: Pam's mom
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah-[hands Michael a snack]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! Eww... apricot. Do you have any of the Very Berry or Ocean Splash or-

Quote.Speaker: Pam's mom
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh... okay. Were you saving it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam's mom
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no, no. That's okay. I was just-I've had a very rough weekend.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. [puts food in his mouth] Ugh. Apricot. Made of real apes.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Do you think they canceled the wedding?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Relax. You'll get your shot at Jim. Those two treat the whole office like a 1970's key party.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: my weekend was bad so far.

Quote.Speaker: Pam's mom
Quote.Text: Oh-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I came here hoping to meet somebody. You know, as you do at weddings. End up going to sleep by the vending machine. It was loud, but it was warm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam's mom
Quote.Text: Oh that sounds awful.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And... and the love of my life is dating somebody else.

Quote.Speaker: Pam's mom
Quote.Text: Oh-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is a terrible year for love.

Quote.Speaker: Pam's mom
Quote.Text: Yeah. Guess it is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm thinking about having my sperm frozen.

Quote.Speaker: Tom Halpert
Quote.Text: Excuse me, are you Michael Scott?

Quote.Speaker: Michel
Quote.Text: Um, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Tom
Quote.Text: Heard you might have a whoopee cushion on you.

Quote.Speaker: Pete Halpert
Quote.Text: Sisters in the can and we totally want to get her when she comes back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, wow. That sounds hilarious. I do actually. [pulls whoopee cushion out of pocket and hands it to them] There you go. Use it in good health.

Quote.Speaker: Tom and Pete
Quote.Text: [laughing] Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Whoa, whoa. Wait a minute. What is the etiquette on taking the gifts? Can you only take your own back or is it a whatever you can carry type of thing?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Anyone have anything they want to trade for a toaster?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, oh, does it have slots for hot dogs?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Who would want it?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Guys, maybe we should wait a little more time before we start grabbing boxes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'd like to lodge a formal complaint against Jim for making us wait for over an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [looks over and sees hole in his present] Crap. [sees turtle on the ground, goes over and picks it up] Come here you.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well I guess this weddings not going to happen. I wonder if this is it for them. [Jim and Pam walk in laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Pam's dad
Quote.Text: Hey. What happened?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Where were you guys? Do you know how long I've been waiting here?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well we are here now, so let's just-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [walks up] Yes! Yes! I have so much joy... in my heart... right now. How do I look?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You look great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You look great.

Quote.Speaker: Tom
Quote.Text: [looks at Jim's cut tie] Wear a tie much?

Quote.Speaker: Penny
Quote.Text: [music starts playing and people start dancing down the isle] I begged them not to.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Penny
Quote.Text: I know you specifically put this song on your Do Not Play list.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes I did.

Quote.Speaker: Penny
Quote.Text: I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [smiles] Go ahead. I think it's your turn.

Quote.Speaker: Penny
Quote.Text: Wait, what happened? You're okay with this?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm okay.

Quote.Speaker: Penny
Quote.Text: Okay then! [takes flower girl to dance down the isle]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Pam, did you see this? It was on You Tube.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Saw it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I bought those boat tickets the day I saw that You Tube video. I knew we'd need a back-up plan. The boat was actually Plan C. The church was Plan B and Plan A was marrying her a long, long time ago. Pretty much the day I met her.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What an awesome party. The best wedding I've ever been too. I got six numbers. One more would have been a complete telephone number. This was epic. My Kleenex shoes were a huge conversation piece, but man my dogs are barking. [sticks his feet into the hotel ice machine] Whoo. My feet were so sweaty I can't even feel the cold. What a lovely hotel.
